goal.ch: Upon completion of the course, students should 1) demonstrate a base of historical and sociological knowledge about urbanism; 2) demonstrate familiarity with a core body of film and video concerning the city; 3) demonstrate the ability to offer informed and compelling written and oral critique of urban issues in media; and 4) demonstrate knowledge of and critical integration of a body of writing on urban issues.
goal.en: Upon completion of the course, students should 1) demonstrate a base of historical and sociological knowledge about urbanism; 2) demonstrate familiarity with a core body of film and video concerning the city; 3) demonstrate the ability to offer informed and compelling written and oral critique of urban issues in media; and 4) demonstrate knowledge of and critical integration of a body of writing on urban issues.

outline.ch: Using an interdisciplinary approach, this course examines how urban life is portrayed in various media forms. Students will discuss and analyze the way film, television and other forms engage with issues of representation, history, politics, economics, culture, ethnicity, and migration related to the urban environment. In this particular section, students will engage with film and television that represents the urban and urban issues from across a range of genres, and across the globe. Alongside film and TV shows, students will read critical, analytical essays that will help to illuminate the representations of urban life portrayed in the media.
